definition: background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base
the bottomless pit (Hell in the Bible)/pitless (elevator)

sentences.english: I am really looking to jump off a bottomless pit, never getout.
sentences.chinese: 我真想找一個無底洞跳下去，永遠出不來。

sentences.english: He thought that he already distinctly perceived the brink of the bottomless abyss.
sentences.chinese: 他彷彿已清清楚楚地望見那無底深淵邊上的陡壁。

sentences.english: It is the eternal mystery, the bottomless pit, the black hole.
sentences.chinese: 黑色是一個永恆的迷，無底坑，黑洞。

sentences.english: She had a bottomless well of love for me.
sentences.chinese: 她有一座無底的井，對我源源不斷流出愛。

sentences.english: Into a bottomless vale I fall - O, I give myself away…
sentences.chinese: 落入一個無底的山谷，噢，我放棄了生命。

sentences.english: Their customers are usually desperate to dig out from under abysmal losses.
sentences.chinese: 他們的客戶一般都想從無底的虧損中解放出來。

sentences.english: At night they stayed in a temple. The evil spirit took Tang Priest to her Bottomless Cave using an evil wind.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚，耗子精用妖風把唐僧擒到住處無底洞。

sentences.english: Truth is the bottom of a bottomless well.
sentences.chinese: 真理是無底之井的井底。

sentences.english: When ordering please advice the VISE without swivel base (W/O)or with swivel base(W).
sentences.chinese: 請於訂購時確認虎鉗爲有底或無底。

sentences.english: Julia said and she jumped down into the dark pit.
sentences.chinese: 茱莉亞說完就跳進了那個無底洞。

sentences.english: The king kicked the foreign herald into a bottomless pit.
sentences.chinese: 國王把國外的使者一腳踢到無底洞裏去。

sentences.english: To this fallen star was given the key of the bottomless pit.
sentences.chinese: 這一下降是由於恆星的關鍵的無底洞。

sentences.english: He would, of course, climb out of it.
sentences.chinese: 當然，他最終從無底的深淵裏爬了出來。
托鉢人的荷包是無底洞。

sentences.english: Decken's sifaka peers out from a jagged stone maw.
sentences.chinese: 一隻德肯狐猴從一處鋸齒狀的石頭無底洞窺視。

definition: to nibble away at sth/to eat into/to erode
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
precious mineral deposits/hidden treasure/(fig.) treasure/(Buddhism) the treasure of Buddha's law
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
